options.content:
Plant Growth Monitoring and Visualization
Mung Beans Sprouts

ðŸŒ±
Indoor
Data Collection (10 Days: 8â€“17 November 2025)

ðŸŒ±
Outdoor
Data Collection (10 Days: 19â€“28 November 2025)

targets.queryText:
SELECT 
    CONCAT(ROUND(SQRT(
        SUM(POWER(temperature - (
            SELECT AVG(temperature) 
            FROM sensor_mbeans_logging 
            WHERE treatment = 'indoor-light'
        ), 2)) 
        / (COUNT(*) - 1)
    ), 2),' Â°C')  AS sd_sample_temperature
FROM sensor_mbeans_logging
WHERE treatment = 'indoor-light';
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT 
    CONCAT(ROUND(SQRT(
        SUM(POWER(temperature - (
            SELECT AVG(temperature) 
            FROM sensor_mbeans_logging 
            WHERE treatment = 'indoor-light'
        ), 2)) 
        / (COUNT(*) - 1)
    ), 2),' Â°C')  AS sd_sample_temperature
FROM sensor_mbeans_logging
WHERE treatment = 'indoor-light';

targets.queryText:
SELECT 
    CONCAT(ROUND(SQRT(
        SUM(POWER(humidity - (
            SELECT AVG(humidity) 
            FROM sensor_mbeans_logging 
            WHERE treatment = 'indoor-light'
        ), 2)) 
        / (COUNT(*) - 1)
    ), 2),'%')  AS sd_sample_humidity
FROM sensor_mbeans_logging
WHERE treatment = 'indoor-light';
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT 
    CONCAT(ROUND(SQRT(
        SUM(POWER(humidity - (
            SELECT AVG(humidity) 
            FROM sensor_mbeans_logging 
            WHERE treatment = 'indoor-light'
        ), 2)) 
        / (COUNT(*) - 1)
    ), 2),'%')  AS sd_sample_humidity
FROM sensor_mbeans_logging
WHERE treatment = 'indoor-light';

targets.queryText:
SELECT 
    CONCAT(ROUND(SQRT(
        SUM(POWER(height - (
            SELECT AVG(height) 
            FROM growth_observation 
            WHERE treatment = 'indoor-light'
        ), 2)) 
        / (COUNT(*) - 1)
    ), 2),' cm')  AS sd_sample_growth
FROM growth_observation
WHERE treatment = 'indoor-light';
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT 
    CONCAT(ROUND(SQRT(
        SUM(POWER(height - (
            SELECT AVG(height)

            WHERE treatment = 'indoor-light'
        ), 2))

    ), 2),' cm')  AS sd_sample_growth
FROM growth_observation
WHERE treatment = 'indoor-light';

options.content:
ðŸŒ±
Indoor
Data Collection (10 Days: 8â€“17 November 2025)

ðŸŒ±
Outdoor
Data Collection (10 Days: 19â€“28 November 2025)

panels.description: Filtered by observation time and day of experiment

targets.queryText: SELECT REPLACE(timestamp_, ' ', 'T') || '+09:00' AS logged_at, temperature AS temperature FROM sensor_mbeans_logging WHERE timestamp_ IS NOT NULL AND temperature IS NOT NULL AND treatment = 'indoor-light' AND observation_time IN ('$observation_time') AND day_of_experiment IN ($day) ORDER BY timestamp_ ASC;
targets.rawQueryText: SELECT REPLACE(timestamp_, ' ', 'T') || '+09:00' AS logged_at, temperature AS temperature FROM sensor_mbeans_logging WHERE timestamp_ IS NOT NULL AND temperature IS NOT NULL AND treatment = 'indoor-light' AND observation_time IN ('$observation_time') AND day_of_experiment IN ($day) ORDER BY timestamp_ ASC;

panels.title: Daily Temperature by Observation Time

panels.description: Filtered by observation time and day of experiment

targets.queryText: SELECT REPLACE(timestamp_, ' ', 'T') || '+09:00' AS logged_at, temperature AS temperature FROM sensor_mbeans_logging WHERE timestamp_ IS NOT NULL AND temperature IS NOT NULL AND treatment = 'outdoor-light' AND observation_time IN ('noon') AND day_of_experiment IN (10) ORDER BY timestamp_ ASC;
targets.rawQueryText: SELECT REPLACE(timestamp_, ' ', 'T') || '+09:00' AS logged_at, temperature AS temperature FROM sensor_mbeans_logging WHERE timestamp_ IS NOT NULL AND temperature IS NOT NULL AND treatment = 'outdoor-light' AND observation_time IN ('$observation_time') AND day_of_experiment IN ($day) ORDER BY timestamp_ ASC;

targets.rawQueryText: SELECT REPLACE(timestamp_, ' ', 'T') || '+09:00' AS logged_at, humidity AS humidity FROM sensor_mbeans_logging WHERE timestamp_ IS NOT NULL AND humidity IS NOT NULL AND treatment = 'outdoor-light' AND observation_time IN ('$observation_time') AND day_of_experiment IN ($day) ORDER BY timestamp_ ASC;

panels.title: Daily Humidity by Observation Time

targets.queryText:
SELECT
    day_of_experiment,
    MAX(CASE WHEN observation_time = 'morning' THEN height END) AS morning_height,
    MAX(CASE WHEN observation_time = 'noon' THEN height END) AS noon_height,
    MAX(CASE WHEN observation_time = 'afternoon' THEN height END) AS afternoon_height
FROM growth_observation
WHERE day_of_experiment BETWEEN 1 AND 10 AND treatment='indoor-light'
GROUP BY day_of_experiment
ORDER BY day_of_experiment;
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT
    day_of_experiment,
    MAX(CASE WHEN observation_time = 'morning' THEN height END) AS morning_height,
    MAX(CASE WHEN observation_time = 'noon' THEN height END) AS noon_height,
    MAX(CASE WHEN observation_time = 'afternoon' THEN height END) AS afternoon_height
FROM growth_observation
WHERE day_of_experiment BETWEEN 1 AND 10 AND treatment='indoor-light'
GROUP BY day_of_experiment
ORDER BY day_of_experiment;

panels.title: Daily Plant Growth by Observation Time

targets.queryText:
SELECT
    day_of_experiment,
    MAX(CASE WHEN observation_time = 'morning' THEN height END) AS morning_height,
    MAX(CASE WHEN observation_time = 'noon' THEN height END) AS noon_height,
    MAX(CASE WHEN observation_time = 'afternoon' THEN height END) AS afternoon_height
FROM growth_observation
WHERE day_of_experiment BETWEEN 1 AND 10 AND treatment='outdoor-light'
GROUP BY day_of_experiment
ORDER BY day_of_experiment;

SELECT
    day_of_experiment,
    MAX(CASE WHEN observation_time = 'morning' THEN height END) AS morning_height,
    MAX(CASE WHEN observation_time = 'noon' THEN height END) AS noon_height,
    MAX(CASE WHEN observation_time = 'afternoon' THEN height END) AS afternoon_height
FROM growth_observation
WHERE day_of_experiment BETWEEN 1 AND 10 AND treatment='outdoor-light'
GROUP BY day_of_experiment
ORDER BY day_of_experiment;

options.content:
ðŸŒ±
Indoor
Data Collection (10 Days: 8â€“17 November 2025)

ðŸŒ±
Outdoor
Data Collection (10 Days: 19â€“28 November 2025)

panels.description: Filtered by observation time and day of experiment, and grouped by logged time.

targets.queryText:
SELECT
    correlation_value,
    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN 'Negative Correlation: As temperature increases, humidity decreases. As temperature decreases, humidity increases.'
        WHEN correlation_value = 0 THEN 'No Correlation: Temperature and humidity do not influence each other.'
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN 'Positive Correlation: As temperature increases, humidity also increases. 
        As temperature decreases, humidity also decreases.'
        ELSE 'Undefined'
    END AS correlation_label,
    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN
            'When the plant is kept indoors, warmer and more humid air can help maintain leaf moisture and prevent the plant from drying out too quickly.'
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN
            'When the plant is kept indoors, warmer air that becomes drier can cause the leaves to lose moisture more quickly, making the plant more prone to drying out.'
        WHEN correlation_value = 0 THEN
            'When the plant is kept indoors, warmer air does not necessarily make the environment more humid or drier, so the effect on the plantâ€™s leaf moisture is uncertain.'
        ELSE
            'No clear interpretation.'
    END AS interpretation
FROM (
    SELECT
        (
            (COUNT(*) * SUM(x * y) - SUM(x) * SUM(y)) /
            (SQRT(
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(x * x) - SUM(x) * SUM(x)) *
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(y * y) - SUM(y) * SUM(y))
            ))
        ) AS correlation_value
    FROM (
        SELECT
            temperature AS x,
            humidity AS y
        FROM sensor_mbeans_logging
        WHERE temperature IS NOT NULL
          AND humidity IS NOT NULL
          AND treatment = 'indoor-light'
          AND observation_time IN ('$observation_time')
          AND day_of_experiment IN ($day) GROUP by timestamp_
    )
);
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT
    correlation_value,
    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN 'Negative Correlation: As temperature increases, humidity decreases. As temperature decreases, humidity increases.'
        WHEN correlation_value = 0 THEN 'No Correlation: Temperature and humidity do not influence each other.'
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN 'Positive Correlation: As temperature increases, humidity also increases. 
        As temperature decreases, humidity also decreases.'
        ELSE 'Undefined'
    END AS correlation_label,
    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN
            'When the plant is kept indoors, warmer and more humid air can help maintain leaf moisture and prevent the plant from drying out too quickly.'
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN
            'When the plant is kept indoors, warmer air that becomes drier can cause the leaves to lose moisture more quickly, making the plant more prone to drying out.'
        WHEN correlation_value = 0 THEN
            'When the plant is kept indoors, warmer air does not necessarily make the environment more humid or drier, so the effect on the plantâ€™s leaf moisture is uncertain.'
        ELSE
            'No clear interpretation.'
    END AS interpretation
FROM (
    SELECT
        (
            (COUNT(*) * SUM(x * y) - SUM(x) * SUM(y)) /
            (SQRT(
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(x * x) - SUM(x) * SUM(x)) *
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(y * y) - SUM(y) * SUM(y))
            ))
        ) AS correlation_value
    FROM (
        SELECT
            temperature AS x,
            humidity AS y
        FROM sensor_mbeans_logging
        WHERE temperature IS NOT NULL
          AND humidity IS NOT NULL
          AND treatment = 'indoor-light'
          AND observation_time IN ('$observation_time')
          AND day_of_experiment IN ($day) GROUP by timestamp_
    )
);

panels.title: Correlation Between Temperature and Humidity

panels.description: Filtered by observation time and day of experiment, and grouped by logged time.

targets.queryText:
SELECT
    correlation_value,
    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN 'Negative Correlation: As temperature increases, humidity decreases. As temperature decreases, humidity increases.'
        WHEN correlation_value = 0 THEN 'No Correlation: Temperature and humidity do not influence each other.'
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN 'Positive Correlation: As temperature increases, humidity also increases. 
        As temperature decreases, humidity also decreases.'
        ELSE 'Undefined'
    END AS correlation_label,
    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN
            'When the plant is kept outdoors, warmer and more humid air can help maintain leaf moisture and prevent the plant from drying out too quickly. However, other influencing factors include wind, sunlight, cloud cover, and rainfall.'
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN
            'When the plant is kept outdoors, warmer air that becomes drier can cause the leaves to lose moisture more quickly, making the plant more prone to drying out. However, other influencing factors include wind, sunlight, cloud cover, and rainfall.'
        WHEN correlation_value = 0 THEN
            'When the plant is kept outdoors, warmer air does not necessarily make the environment more humid or drier, so the effect on the plantâ€™s leaf moisture is uncertain.'
        ELSE
            'No clear interpretation.'
    END AS interpretation
FROM (
    SELECT
        (
            (COUNT(*) * SUM(x * y) - SUM(x) * SUM(y)) /
            (SQRT(
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(x * x) - SUM(x) * SUM(x)) *
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(y * y) - SUM(y) * SUM(y))
            ))
        ) AS correlation_value
    FROM (
        SELECT
            temperature AS x,
            humidity AS y
        FROM sensor_mbeans_logging
        WHERE temperature IS NOT NULL
          AND humidity IS NOT NULL
          AND treatment = 'outdoor-light'
          AND observation_time IN ('$observation_time')
          AND day_of_experiment IN ($day) GROUP BY timestamp_
    )
);

        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN 'Negative Correlation: As temperature increases, humidity decreases. As temperature decreases, humidity increases.'

            'When the plant is kept outdoors, warmer air that becomes drier can cause the leaves to lose moisture more quickly, making the plant more prone to drying out. However, other influencing factors include wind, sunlight, cloud cover, and rainfall.'
        WHEN correlation_value = 0 THEN
            'When the plant is kept outdoors, warmer air does not necessarily make the environment more humid or drier, so the effect on the plantâ€™s leaf moisture is uncertain.'

    END AS interpretation

        (
            (COUNT(*) * SUM(x * y) - SUM(x) * SUM(y)) /

panels.title: Relationship Between Temperature and Humidity

panels.description: Filtered by observation time and day of experiment.

targets.queryText: SELECT temperature AS temperature, humidity as humidity FROM sensor_mbeans_logging WHERE temperature IS NOT NULL AND humidity IS NOT NULL AND treatment = 'indoor-light' AND observation_time IN ('$observation_time') AND day_of_experiment IN ($day);
targets.rawQueryText: SELECT temperature AS temperature, humidity as humidity FROM sensor_mbeans_logging WHERE temperature IS NOT NULL AND humidity IS NOT NULL AND treatment = 'indoor-light' AND observation_time IN ('$observation_time') AND day_of_experiment IN ($day);

panels.title: Relationship Between Temperature and Humidity

panels.description: Filtered by observation time and day of experiment.

targets.queryText: SELECT temperature AS temperature, humidity as humidity FROM sensor_mbeans_logging WHERE temperature IS NOT NULL AND humidity IS NOT NULL AND treatment = 'outdoor-light' AND observation_time IN ('morning') AND day_of_experiment IN (10);
targets.rawQueryText: SELECT temperature AS temperature, humidity as humidity FROM sensor_mbeans_logging WHERE temperature IS NOT NULL AND humidity IS NOT NULL AND treatment = 'outdoor-light' AND observation_time IN ('$observation_time') AND day_of_experiment IN ($day);

panels.title: Relationship Between Temperature and Humidity

panels.description: Aggregated by average of temperature and group by observation time.

targets.queryText:
SELECT
    correlation_value,

    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN 'Positive Correlation'
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN 'Negative Correlation'
        ELSE 'No Correlation'
    END AS correlation_category,

    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN 
            'As temperature increases, plant growth tends to increase.'
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN 
            'As temperature increases, plant growth tends to decrease.'
        ELSE
            'Temperature has little to no linear relationship with plant growth.'
    END AS interpretation
FROM (
    SELECT
        (
            (COUNT(*) * SUM(t.avg_temp * g.height) - SUM(t.avg_temp) * SUM(g.height)) /
            (SQRT(
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(t.avg_temp * t.avg_temp) - SUM(t.avg_temp) * SUM(t.avg_temp)) *
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(g.height * g.height) - SUM(g.height) * SUM(g.height))
            ))
        ) AS correlation_value
    FROM (
        SELECT
            day_of_experiment,
            observation_time,
            AVG(temperature) AS avg_temp
        FROM sensor_mbeans_logging
        WHERE temperature IS NOT NULL
          AND treatment = 'indoor-light'
        GROUP BY day_of_experiment, observation_time
    ) t
    LEFT JOIN growth_observation g
           ON t.day_of_experiment = g.day_of_experiment
          AND t.observation_time = g.observation_time
    WHERE g.height IS NOT NULL
      AND g.treatment = 'indoor-light'
) AS corr;
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT
    correlation_value,

    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN 'Positive Correlation'
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN 'Negative Correlation'
        ELSE 'No Correlation'
    END AS correlation_category,

    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN 
            'As temperature increases, plant growth tends to increase.'
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN 
            'As temperature increases, plant growth tends to decrease.'
        ELSE
            'Temperature has little to no linear relationship with plant growth.'
    END AS interpretation
FROM (
    SELECT
        (
            (COUNT(*) * SUM(t.avg_temp * g.height) - SUM(t.avg_temp) * SUM(g.height)) /
            (SQRT(
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(t.avg_temp * t.avg_temp) - SUM(t.avg_temp) * SUM(t.avg_temp)) *
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(g.height * g.height) - SUM(g.height) * SUM(g.height))
            ))
        ) AS correlation_value
    FROM (
        SELECT
            day_of_experiment,
            observation_time,
            AVG(temperature) AS avg_temp
        FROM sensor_mbeans_logging
        WHERE temperature IS NOT NULL
          AND treatment = 'indoor-light'
        GROUP BY day_of_experiment, observation_time
    ) t
    LEFT JOIN growth_observation g
           ON t.day_of_experiment = g.day_of_experiment
          AND t.observation_time = g.observation_time
    WHERE g.height IS NOT NULL
      AND g.treatment = 'indoor-light'
) AS corr;

            day_of_experiment,
            observation_time,
            AVG(humidity) AS avg_hum
        FROM sensor_mbeans_logging
        WHERE humidity IS NOT NULL
          AND treatment = 'indoor-light'
        GROUP BY day_of_experiment, observation_time
    ) t
    LEFT JOIN growth_observation g
           ON t.day_of_experiment = g.day_of_experiment
          AND t.observation_time = g.observation_time
    WHERE g.height IS NOT NULL
      AND g.treatment = 'indoor-light'
) AS corr;

panels.title: Correlation Between Humidity and Plant Growth (Overall)

panels.description: Aggregated by average of temperature and group by observation time.

targets.queryText:
SELECT
    correlation_value,

    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN 'Positive Correlation'
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN 'Negative Correlation'
        ELSE 'No Correlation'
    END AS correlation_category,

    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN 
            'As humidity increases, plant growth tends to increase.'
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN 
            'As humidity increases, plant growth tends to decrease.'
        ELSE
            'Temperature has little to no linear relationship with plant growth.'
    END AS interpretation
FROM (
    SELECT
        (
            (COUNT(*) * SUM(t.avg_hum * g.height) - SUM(t.avg_hum) * SUM(g.height)) /
            (SQRT(
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(t.avg_hum * t.avg_hum) - SUM(t.avg_hum) * SUM(t.avg_hum)) *
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(g.height * g.height) - SUM(g.height) * SUM(g.height))
            ))
        ) AS correlation_value
    FROM (
        SELECT
            day_of_experiment,
            observation_time,
            AVG(humidity) AS avg_hum
        FROM sensor_mbeans_logging
        WHERE humidity IS NOT NULL
          AND treatment = 'outdoor-light'
        GROUP BY day_of_experiment, observation_time
    ) t
    LEFT JOIN growth_observation g
           ON t.day_of_experiment = g.day_of_experiment
          AND t.observation_time = g.observation_time
    WHERE g.height IS NOT NULL
      AND g.treatment = 'outdoor-light'
) AS corr;
targets.rawQueryText:
SELECT
    correlation_value,

    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN 'Positive Correlation'
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN 'Negative Correlation'
        ELSE 'No Correlation'
    END AS correlation_category,

    CASE
        WHEN correlation_value > 0 THEN 
            'As humidity increases, plant growth tends to increase.'
        WHEN correlation_value < 0 THEN 
            'As humidity increases, plant growth tends to decrease.'
        ELSE
            'Temperature has little to no linear relationship with plant growth.'
    END AS interpretation
FROM (
    SELECT
        (
            (COUNT(*) * SUM(t.avg_hum * g.height) - SUM(t.avg_hum) * SUM(g.height)) /
            (SQRT(
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(t.avg_hum * t.avg_hum) - SUM(t.avg_hum) * SUM(t.avg_hum)) *
                (COUNT(*) * SUM(g.height * g.height) - SUM(g.height) * SUM(g.height))
            ))
        ) AS correlation_value
    FROM (
        SELECT
            day_of_experiment,
            observation_time,
            AVG(humidity) AS avg_hum
        FROM sensor_mbeans_logging
        WHERE humidity IS NOT NULL
          AND treatment = 'outdoor-light'
        GROUP BY day_of_experiment, observation_time
    ) t
    LEFT JOIN growth_observation g
           ON t.day_of_experiment = g.day_of_experiment
          AND t.observation_time = g.observation_time
    WHERE g.height IS NOT NULL
      AND g.treatment = 'outdoor-light'
) AS corr;
